column4: I'm waiting for my new laptop and deciding to go w/ kubuntu or ubuntu
I used to use Ubuntu, now I'm using Kubuntu, but I'm wondering if things are more polished on Ubuntu and trickle down to Kubuntu
I do find that Kubuntu is buggy as hell at times
Why do people even deal w/ KDE? From my experience, it's never been "stable"
My buddy is a die-hard KDE fan
got me to convert for a little while
I agree KDE is nicer looking w/ "glass-like" effects and stuff
your experience is anecdotal and "Anecdotal evidence is not evidence at all" XD
vlc uses its own framwork as does xine
yes amarok uses phonon but phonon is a thing layer on top of gstreamer or libxine or directX (in windows)
yes; and this is getting offtopic... ;P
